unnormalised: Okay, so Diwali's just around the corner, right? Like, seriously, can you believe it's already October? Time flies, man. I remember last year's Diwali like it was yesterday. The whole family was together at our Delhi house, and the kids were bursting crackers since 6 PM.
normalised: Okay, so Diwali's just around the corner, right? Like, seriously, can you believe it's already October? Time flies, man. I remember last year's Diwali like it was yesterday. The whole family was together at our Delhi house, and the kids were bursting crackers since six P-M.

unnormalised: This year, Diwali falls on 01/11/2024. I've already started prepping! Mom's got her eye on that new saree she saw online. Dad’s planning the Lakshmi Puja for 7:15 PM sharp. Very auspicious time, he says.
normalised: This year, Diwali falls on first November two thousand and twenty four. I've already started prepping! Mom's got her eye on that new saree she saw online. Dad’s planning the Lakshmi Puja for seven fifteen P-M sharp. Very auspicious time, he says.

unnormalised: We’re actually heading to Kolkata this year! My cousin's getting married the week after, so we're prepone-ing our Diwali trip. Should be fun, though I'm a bit worried about the pollution. Hope the AQI isn't too bad on 11/2.
normalised: We’re actually heading to Kolkata this year! My cousin's getting married the week after, so we're preponing our Diwali trip. Should be fun, though I'm a bit worried about the pollution. Hope the A-Q-I isn't too bad on second November.

unnormalised: Planning to hit up New Market, maybe pick up some sweets and gifts. My niece wants one of those fancy lehengas she saw in a Bollywood movie. Kids these days! They're already thinking about Bhai Dooj, which is on 3/11 this year, barely 2 days after Diwali itself.
normalised: Planning to hit up New Market, maybe pick up some sweets and gifts. My niece wants one of those fancy lehengas she saw in a Bollywood movie. Kids these days! They're already thinking about Bhai Dooj, which is on third November this year, barely two days after Diwali itself.

unnormalised: Speaking of sweets, I'm trying to convince Mom to try some new recipes this year. Maybe some sugar-free stuff for Uncle Sharma, since he’s been diagnosed with diabetes type 2. She usually starts making mithai 2 weeks beforehand, so that will be from 18/10 onwards.
normalised: Speaking of sweets, I'm trying to convince Mom to try some new recipes this year. Maybe some sugar-free stuff for Uncle Sharma, since he’s been diagnosed with diabetes type two. She usually starts making mithai two weeks beforehand, so that will be from eighteenth October onwards.

unnormalised: Remember to stay safe during the festivities! Don't be an idiot with the firecrackers and maybe wear a mask, especially if you're in a polluted city like Delhi or Kanpur. The pollution gets really bad after 8 pm on Diwali night.
normalised: Remember to stay safe during the festivities! Don't be an idiot with the firecrackers and maybe wear a mask, especially if you're in a polluted city like Delhi or Kanpur. The pollution gets really bad after eight P-M on Diwali night.

unnormalised: Anyway, happy Diwali in advance everyone! May your Diwali be filled with joy, laughter, and lots of delicious food. See you all on 1 Nov!
normalised: Anyway, happy Diwali in advance everyone! May your Diwali be filled with joy, laughter, and lots of delicious food. See you all on first November!
